forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South wind around 20 mph, with gusts as high as 36 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 49, with temperatures rising to around 51 overnight. South southwest wind 9 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The afternoon in Downtown San Francisco unfolds beneath a thick blanket of gray clouds, the air saturated with the unmistakable fragrance of rain. Amidst the steady drizzle, temperatures hover just shy of 60 degrees, ebbing to 57 as the day wanes, further coaxing warmth from those surrendering to the damp chill. Breezes from the south weave through the streets, gusting with vigor, rattling the dry remnants of the day and carrying the promise of more rain—a resolute 100% chance remains as dusk approaches.

Tonight, the rain will persist, and a gentle rise in temperature offers a fleeting respite from the chill, reaching around 51 degrees—just enough warmth to encourage a cozy embrace from your layers. The fog wraps itself tightly around the Bay, shrouding the Golden Gate, but the robust city skyline peeks through the mist. As the evening draws near, consider settling in for a quiet session with a good book at a favorite café, or indulging in a leisurely dinner at a nearby restaurant where warmth and hearty dishes await, inviting you to relish the warmth against the cool, damp air. A scarf and waterproof jacket will serve you well, providing comfort against the persistent patter of rain and the brisk winds.
